Tech companies have gotten increasingly secretive about the data, scraped from the internet without compensation or consent, used to train their AI models. So we looked closer. Here's our analysis of the 15 million websites in just one highly-filtered CommonCrawl web scrape-used to train models like Google's T5 & Facebook's LLaMA.
We found
-the copyright symbol appears >200M times
-pirated sites, 1 for e-books
-half of the top 10 were news sites https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/interactive/2023/ai-chatbot-learning

title: University of Glasgow - Schools - School of Psychology & Neuroscience  - Research - Pedagogy and Education Research Unit (PERU)

last_post.content:
Very excited to share the new Pedagogy and Education Research Unit at UofG Psych Neuro. Our activities and research have a strong applied focus as well as being underpinned by a commitment to open science and open educational resources.

https://www.gla.ac.uk/schools/psychologyneuroscience/research/peru/

The unit consists of three themes: Access, Inclusion and Wellbeing led by Chiara Horlin, Applied Cognition in Learning and Teaching led by Carolina Kuepper-Tetzel, and Open Science and Pedagogy led by @HelenaPaterson

If you'd like to be added to the Team, let me know!

#pedagogy #education #scholarship #educationresearch

The @CopernicusECMWF report on climate change has an urgent message to get across. Clearly effort was put in making it accessible and appealing to read, with stunning satellite images and stylish data visualisations. It makes for good #dataviz reading, because different graph types from pictograms to map overlays are used to distill the essentials from complex data. Some work better than others in my eyes, but the form and style range is very valuable as reference.

https://climate.copernicus.eu/sites/default/files/custom-uploads/ESOTC2022/PR/ESOTCsummary2022_pdf-GC-v7.0.pdf

#RStats 📦 developers who use {testthat}, imagine a situation where a perfect script - test filename correspondance isn't enough (or isn't present 😅 )

😰 a few tests of yours are failing for a mysterious yet possibly related reason 😱

With @kirill's {lazytest}, you can

🧯 re-run only failed tests as you work on a fix;
🚥 until they pass at which point all tests are run (to check you haven't broken something else 🤪 ).

title: Open Structures – conference on data, tools and cultures in research

last_post.content:
Call for Papers: OPEN STRUCTURES – conference on data, tools and cultures in research

Wir freuen uns, den Call for Papers für unsere bevorstehende Konferenz "OPEN STRUCTURES" (23./24. November 2023) ankündigen zu können.

Im Zentrum steht die Frage, wie die Digitalisierung die Forschung über die gebaute Umwelt verändert hat.

Deadline für Abstracts ist der 01. Juni 2023!

Weitere Informationen finden Sie auf unserer Konferenz-Website https://www.open-structures.com/

A new Misskey/Calckey client for iOS just came out!

It’s called Kimis. Unlike other clients, the interface is accessible in English.

This is much needed because Misskey doesn’t use Mastodon’s API—it has its own. Which means most Fediverse clients aren’t usable with Misskey.

But that’s okay because Kimis is here to the rescue!

The download link is here:

https://apps.apple.com/ca/app/kimis-a-client-for-misskey/id1667275125

Also see screenshots of me running Kimis with my Calckey account on vancity.social.

@fediversenews

I guess now's a good time to spruik a #journalism project I've had going on in the background

Open Newswire is a free aggregator of news articles published under #CreativeCommons or similar licences, and it's available in some 90 languages and counting

The idea is to create a free alternative to a newswire by combining republishable articles from hundreds of sources around the world

Read on in the thread below - I'd love to hear your thoughts!

Good morning, Fediverse! :bob_ross:

How are you all doing this week? Are you okay? New users, are you settling in on your respective instances?

I have a bunch of useful links in this toot that you may find helpful for getting to grips with Mastodon/Fedi : https://mastodon.art/@Curator/109330938776710411

It can feel daunting and overwhelming using new software for the first time, and your new fedi home should feel like a community, so I'd like to help you get comfy! Let me know how I can help <3

Last call!

If you can, *please* sponsor my friend, Ben, who is running the London marathon to support VersusArthritis in my name.

All my health problems - from stroke to kidney failure - stem from rheumatoid arthritis. This charity's work has saved my life.

Sports Illustrated is reporting that the Oakland A's, like the Raiders before them, are abandoning their fans here and moving to Las Vegas:

https://www.si.com/fannation/mlb/fastball/news/breaking-oakland-athletics-closing-in-on-stadium-deal-in-las-vegas

Fortunately, there's a thriving local organization fielding both men's and women's professional soccer teams. The games and the tailgates are a blast, and tickets are affordably prices for families:

https://www.oaklandrootssc.com/
https://www.oaklandsoulsc.com/

What goes to Vegas belongs in Vegas.

I do the NYT crossword most mornings as I drink my coffee. Today's was a themed puzzle, which I usually like. Once you figure out the theme, you have a bunch of information that helps you solve the puzzle.

I finished the puzzle today with really no idea how the theme related to the answers in the grid. Had to hit the cheat site to figure it out. An impressive, if rather bent, job by Simeon Seigel.

title: The ‘Pity City’ CEO Is Sorry Now

last_post.content: The ‘Pity City’ CEO Is Sorry Now - https://www.vice.com/en/article/ak3gy8/the-pity-city-ceo-is-sorry-now

ah, there we go, got that ✔️

For those curious, the technical path it took was:

1. Adding the link to the wikipedia.org template: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/wikimedia/portals/+/908683

2. Merging the automated weekly portal build that fills in the template: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/wikimedia/portals/deploy/+/909190

3. Updating the git submodule in the main deployment repository: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/operations/mediawiki-config/+/909303

4. Actually deploying the change: https://sal.toolforge.org/log/lfLsj4cBxE1_1c7sI5sQ

ah, there we go, got that ✔️

For those curious, the technical path it took was:

1. Adding the link to the wikipedia.org template: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/wikimedia/portals/+/908683

2. Merging the automated weekly portal build that fills in the template: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/wikimedia/portals/deploy/+/909190

3. Updating the git submodule in the main deployment repository: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/operations/mediawiki-config/+/909303

4. Actually deploying the change: https://sal.toolforge.org/log/lfLsj4cBxE1_1c7sI5sQ

Last Saturday I watched the one-two punch of boygenius and Blackpink at Coachella and got kind of shaken up. Here are words and pictures on the subject: https://www.tbray.org/ongoing/When/202x/2023/04/16/Girl-Bands

#Music

Ethical debt happens when tech developers don't take enough time to consider consequences before deployment, and instead wait to see what the "bugs" will be. Which requires speculation about likely consequences... but that doesn't mean imagining sci-fi futures. *Near-term* speculation is even more important when it's so clear what the immediate harms of AI can be... (wrote about this for @TheConversationUS ) https://theconversation.com/ai-has-social-consequences-but-who-pays-the-price-tech-companies-problem-with-ethical-debt-203375
